elements.title: The Investigative Reporting Behind America’s Obsession With Britney Spears’ Conservatorship

Today’s essential reads

The Investigative Reporting Behind America’s Obsession With Britney Spears’ Conservatorship

ProPublica · 9 min

Years ago, ProPublica Managing Editor Robin Fields investigated California conservatorships. Recently, she interviewed New York Times Senior Story Editor Liz Day about the reporting in the “Framing Britney Spears” documentary.

Jason Sudeikis Is Having One Hell of a Year

GQ · 23 min

Still, Life

bittersoutherner.com · 12 min

Fascinating stories

How to Turn Off Harmful Stress Like a Switch

Nir Eyal · 10 min

Stress comes from anxiety about future problems and the lack of control over them. This article introduces a few surprising techniques to handle stress.

What Happened to Peanut Butter and Jelly?

daily.jstor.org · 3 min

There was a time when peanut butter and jelly, spread generously on two simple slices of bread, was a quintessential American meal. But sometimes a great rise can also mean a great fall. And the mighty PB&J has fallen.

The five-day workweek is dead

Vox · 11 min

There’s nothing inevitable about working eight hours a day, five days a week (or more).

Twenty-Five Useful Thinking Tools

Scott Young · 20 min

The tricks that different professions can offer the world.

You Can Unshrink Your Shrunken Clothes

Lifehacker · 3 min

Don't toss your favorite shirt after it shrunk in the dryer. You can save it.

Emergency Medicine’s Original Sin

The Atlantic · 6 min

The misperception that paramedics are merely ambulance drivers is everyone’s problem.

6 Popular Intermittent Fasting Schedules For Weight Loss, Explained By Experts

Why disagreement is vital to advancing human understanding

Aeon · 15 min

There Are Three Sides to Every Argument

TED Ideas · 10 min

Inside Shohei Ohtani’s Superhero Origin Story

The Ringer · 24 min

Ohtani is in the midst of a hyperbole-proof season during which he’s dominated on the mound and at the plate. But that may never have happened had one enterprising Japanese team not made a few very bold decisions.

Why Venice Is Disappearing

Rolling Stone · 5 min

Flooding in the historic city is about more than climate change — bad engineering and corruption are also to blame.

Ranch Isn’t a Dressing. It’s a Lifestyle.

tastecooking.com · 4 min

For many, it’s a topping for pizza or a flavor for snack foods. But for some, it’s just a way of life.

What to Read When You Grew Up with the Baby-Sitters Club

therumpus.net · 7 min

There’s something special about the Baby-Sitters Club—something that compels those of us who grew up with it (or who are just discovering it today) to fully geek out when we find each other.

Your “Dream Job” Is a Myth

Slate · 5 min

It’s impossible to tell how perfect a position truly is until you’re in it.
